Title: Effect of E-WOM and social media usage on purchase decision in clothing industry
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Tjhin, V.U., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Aini, S.R.N., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The aim of this study was to determine the effect of social media usage and electronic word of mouth (E-WOM) on purchase decision through consumer trust. This research was conducted on customers of clothing industry in Indonesia. The study conducted survey and collected data from a sample of 151 respondents who buy clothing products online by using convenience sampling method. The study analyzed data using Partial Least Square Structure Equation Modeling (PLS-SEM). The results of this study found that social media usage does not have a significant effect on purchase decision. Social media usage also does not have a significant effect on trust. E-WOM has a significant effect on purchase decision. E-WOM has a significant effect on trust. Trust has a significant effect on purchase decision. Social media usage and E-WOM has no significant effect on purchase decision mediated by trust. © 2019 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Clothing industry; E-WOM; Purchase decision; Social media usage; Trust
Index Keywords: Sales; Social networking (online); Surveys; Clothing industry; Electronic word of mouths; Partial least square (PLS); Purchase decision; Sampling method; Social media; Structure equation models; Trust; Mobile commerce
